page.title: 15THE COLLEGE SITE
page.content:
The present grounds which the college occupies has performed four functions and it is only since 1843 that there has been the famous{Public School}in Marlborough.
A{castle}of wood was the first buiding on the mound later replaced by a more permanent structure of stone. The private college pool is found in what is left of the moat and the mound proved ideal for the keeps.
Once this had been demolished a {private house}was built, which remains standing today as a boarding house. Records show that King Charles II and William Pitt the elder have stayed in the house, either when it was private or when it was transformed into a {coaching house}- a pleasant stop for travellers to and from Bath and London
